it.polito.computervision.gestures.impl

Class PanGesture

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polito.computervision.gestures.AbstractGesture
      • it.polito.computervision.gestures.OneHandGesture
        • it.polito.computervision.gestures.impl.PanGesture
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Gesture

    public class PanGesture
extends OneHandGesture
    Implements a pan or swipe gesture. Can be configured with allowed directions, thresholds and can be either live or non-live. Custom data: - initialPosition: Point2D (the projected position where the hand touched the screen first)
    Author:
    Giovanni Piumatti

        public PanGesture(java.lang.String name)

      • PanGesture

        public PanGesture(java.lang.String name,
          java.util.EnumSet<PanGesture.Direction> directions,
          boolean live)
        Creates a pan gesture with the given name, allowed directions, live or not. Uses default thresholds.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the gesture
        directions - The set of allowed directions
        live - Whether this is a live gesture or not

      • PanGesture

        public PanGesture(java.lang.String name,
          java.util.EnumSet<PanGesture.Direction> directions,
          float detectionThreshold,
          float completionThreshold,
          boolean live)
        Creates a PanGesture with the given name, all other options configurable
        Parameters:
        name - The name of this Gesture.
        directions - The directions allowed for this gesture
        detectionThreshold - The distance (in mm in real world coordinates) the hand has to travel before triggering detection
        completionThreshold - The distance (in mm in real world coordinates) the hand has to travel before triggering completion
        live - Whether this is a live gesture or not

    • Method Detail

      • doReset

        protected void doReset()
        Description copied from class: AbstractGesture
        Implementations should place their reset logic here
        Overrides:
        doReset in class OneHandGesture

      • doUpdateState

        public GestureState doUpdateState(HandData currentlyTrackedHand,
                         boolean touchReleased)
        Concrete gestures must implement this method. The semantics are the same of Gesture.updateState(List,List). When a hand touches the screen, that becomes the currently tracked hand, and is passed to this method until either a AbstractGesture.reset() is called or the hand is lost (not tracked anymore).
        Specified by:
        doUpdateState in class OneHandGesture
        Parameters:
        currentlyTrackedHand - The HandData currently being tracked for this gesture, or null if no hand is being tracked yet
        touchReleased - true if the touch was released, false otherwise (i.e. there are more than 1 hand touching)
        Returns:
        The GestureState this gesture is in after the update.
